ProductLine

Class ProductLineController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ProductLine.ProductLineController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class ProductLineController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class represents the controller component of the MVC. It responds to action events and user stimuli at the GUI layer and handles requests appropriately.

    Class inherits from DatabaseOrg class to allow access to instance methods and fields.

    Author:
    Ryan Yerge

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProductLineController

        public ProductLineController()

    • Method Detail

      • handleAddProductButtonAction

        protected void handleAddProductButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Event handler for when the "Add Products" button is pressed by the user. Desired product is submitted to the database and setupProductLineTable() is called.
        Parameters:
        event - This is the event object created when "Add Product" is pressed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Exception thrown when database fails to connect.

      • handleRecordProdButtonAction

        protected void handleRecordProdButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Products added to database are shown in the "Produce" tab and allows the user to select quantities of desired products to add to the "Production Log" tab.
        Parameters:
        event - This is the event object created when "Record Production" is pressed by the user.

      • setupProductLineTable

        public void setupProductLineTable(Product productInfo)
        Products added to the database when "Add Product" is clicked calls this method to set up the TableView to reflect submission of items to the database. The item's toString() is called to transpose item information to "Produce" tab for quantity selection.
        Parameters:
        productInfo - Product object is passed to access its toString() method.

      • handleSubmitButtonAction

        protected void handleSubmitButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method handles the submit button action whenever the user inputs their full name and password to "login" to the production line database.

        The Employee's toString() method is called to verify that the user inputted the correct credentials.

        Parameters:
        event - This is the event object created when "Submit" is pressed by the user.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        The initialize() method is implemented from the Initialize interface. It initializes the Quantity ComboBox in the Produce GUI tab to select values 1 - 10. It also initializes the ChoiceBox in the Product Line tab from the ItemType Enum class for the desired item type to be inserted into the database. Production Log window is updated with items currently in DB.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - it's the only usage in Project Files.
        resources - it's the only usage in Project Files.

      • initializeDb

        protected void initializeDb()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connection to database is initialized. Driver type and database URL defined as Strings to be passed to DriverManager. User name and password defined as Strings to be passed to DriverManager.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • insertData

        protected void insertData(java.lang.String prodName,
                          java.lang.String itemType,
                          java.lang.String manufacturer)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Data to be inserted into database is passed. Translates into SQL logic. SQL INSERT statement includes data entered by user at GUI level.
        Parameters:
        prodName - This is the name of the product being added.
        manufacturer - This is the manufacturer of the product being added.
        itemType - This is the type of item being added.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If product fails to be added, an exception is thrown.

      • loadProductList

        protected javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> loadProductList()
                                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is called when the initialize() method loads from the ProductLineController. It returns an ObservableList containing Products currently existing in the database, and it returns the product list to be reflected at the GUI level.
        Returns:
        ObservableList containing existing Products in the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws exception if error occurs while accessing PRODUCT table.

      • insertRecord

        protected void insertRecord(int prodNum,
                            int prodID,
                            java.lang.String serialNum,
                            java.util.Date date)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        The item recorded for production creates a ProductionRecord object and inserts the data to be inserted into PRODUCTIONRECORD table in the db.
        Parameters:
        prodNum - This is the product's number.
        prodID - This is the product's ID number.
        serialNum - This is the serial number generated.
        date - this is the Date object time-stamping the date and time of production.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws exception if error occurs while inserting into db.

      • loadProductionLog

        protected java.util.ArrayList<ProductionRecord> loadProductionLog()
                                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is called from the initialize() method and each time a quantity of products is selected at the GUI level and record for production.
        Returns:
        returns an ArrayList of all the ProductionRecords in the db.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Throws exception if error occurs while selecting from PRODUCTIONRECORD table.
